thread.title: NBA All-Star Weekend 2017: Candace Parker knocks down 3-point shot barefoot for Sager Strong Foundation | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: NBA All-Star Weekend 2017: Candace Parker knocks down 3-point shot barefoot for Sager Strong Foundation | NBA | Sporting News

author: Matt Ellentuck
title: NBA All-Star Weekend 2017: Candace Parker knocks down 3-point shot barefoot for Sager Strong Foundation | NBA | Sporting News
text:
February 18, 2017 9:54pm EST February 18, 2017 9:53pm EST No sneakers necessary for Parker. Sparks forward Candace Parker (Getty Images) 
Updated at 9:54 p.m. ET 
Updated at 9:54 p.m. ET 
NBA All-Star Saturday took a break from the usual lineup of events to celebrate the life of Craig Sager and raise money for the Sager Strong Foundation . 
Athletes and celebrities from the audience came out to shoot 3-point shots from the top of the key. Each made basket in the one minute allowed raised $10,000 for the foundation. 
DJ Khaled came out and knocked one down; James Harden joined him, as well as Nick Cannon, Reggie Miller and others. But only Candace Parker, WNBA Champion and former Los Angeles Sparks MVP, hit one barefoot though. Candace Parker drained the 3 barefoot pic.twitter.com/eioYVPVD2E â Danny (@recordsANDradio) February 19, 2017 
Like seriously, damn.
